documents.title: Browse the web · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: Agents can browse the web using the Browser Rendering API or your preferred headless browser service.
documents.summary: This document explains how to enable web browsing capabilities for agents using the Cloudflare Browser Rendering API or Browserbase, including implementation details and configuration.

documents.title: x402 · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: x402 is an open payment standard that enables services to charge for access to their APIs and content directly over HTTP. It is built around the HTTP 402 Payment Required status code and allows clients to programmatically pay for resources without accounts, sessions, or credential management.
documents.summary: This document introduces the x402 open payment standard for charging for API and content access via HTTP 402 status codes, providing implementation examples for Workers, Agents, and MCP servers.

documents.title: Build Agents on Cloudflare
documents.description: title: Agents · Cloudflare Agents docs description: The Agents SDK enables you to build and deploy AI-powered agents that can autonomously perform tasks, communicate with clients in real time, call AI models, persist state, schedule tasks, run asynchronous workflows, browse the web, query data f...
documents.summary: This document introduces the Cloudflare Agents SDK and provides instructions for building, configuring, and deploying stateful, AI-powered autonomous agents.

documents.title: Patterns · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: This page lists and defines common patterns for implementing AI agents, based on Anthropic's patterns for building effective agents.
documents.summary: This document defines and demonstrates common architectural patterns for building AI agents, such as prompt chaining, routing, and parallelization, using the Vercel AI SDK.

documents.title: Calling Agents · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: Learn how to call your Agents from Workers, including how to create Agents on-the-fly, address them, and route requests to specific instances of an Agent.
documents.summary: This document explains how to create, address, and interact with stateful Agent instances from Workers using routing helpers and direct RPC methods.

documents.title: Agents API · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: This page provides an overview of the Agent SDK API, including the Agent class, methods and properties built-in to the Agents SDK.
documents.summary: This document provides an overview of the Agent SDK API, detailing how to implement server-side logic via the Agent class and connect to instances using the AgentClient.

documents.title: Configuration · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: An Agent is configured like any other Cloudflare Workers project, and uses a wrangler configuration file to define where your code is and what services (bindings) it will use.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure Cloudflare Workers Agents, detailing the required project structure and mandatory fields within the wrangler configuration file.

documents.title: HTTP and Server-Sent Events · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: The Agents SDK allows you to handle HTTP requests and has native support for Server-Sent Events (SSE). This allows you build applications that can push data to clients and avoid buffering.
documents.summary: This document explains how to handle HTTP requests and implement Server-Sent Events (SSE) using the Agents SDK to stream data to clients and compares SSE with WebSockets.

documents.title: Run Workflows · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: Agents can trigger asynchronous Workflows, allowing your Agent to run complex, multi-step tasks in the background. This can include post-processing files that a user has uploaded, updating the embeddings in a vector database, and/or managing long-running user-lifecycle email or SMS notification workflows.
documents.summary: This document explains how to trigger and coordinate asynchronous Cloudflare Workflows from an Agent to handle complex, multi-step background tasks.

documents.title: API Reference · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: Learn more about what Agents can do, the Agent class, and the APIs that Agents expose:
documents.summary: This document provides a directory of the Cloudflare Agents API reference documentation, covering core features such as the Agent class, AI integration, state management, and task scheduling.

documents.title: Schedule tasks · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: An Agent can schedule tasks to be run in the future by calling this.schedule(when, callback, data), where when can be a delay, a Date, or a cron string; callback the function name to call, and data is an object of data to pass to the function.
documents.summary: This document explains how to schedule, manage, and cancel asynchronous tasks within an Agent using delays, specific dates, or cron expressions, including instructions for lifecycle management.

documents.title: Store and sync state · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: Every Agent has built-in state management capabilities, including built-in storage and synchronization between the Agent and frontend applications.
documents.summary: This document explains how to manage persistent state within Agents, detailing the built-in State API for synchronization and the embedded SQL API for direct database interactions.

documents.title: Retrieval Augmented Generation · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: Agents can use Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to retrieve relevant information and use it augment calls to AI models. Store a user's chat history to use as context for future conversations, summarize documents to bootstrap an Agent's knowledge base, and/or use data from your Agent's web browsing tasks to enhance your Agent's capabilities.
documents.summary: This document explains how to implement Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) in Cloudflare Agents by combining vector databases and SQL for data storage and retrieval. It provides guidance on querying vector indexes and generating embeddings to enhance an Agent's knowledge base.

documents.title: Using WebSockets · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: Users and clients can connect to an Agent directly over WebSockets, allowing long-running, bi-directional communication with your Agent as it operates.
documents.summary: This document explains how to implement bi-directional WebSocket communication between Agents and clients, including server-side event handling and client-side integration using JavaScript or React.

documents.title: Human in the Loop · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: Human-in-the-Loop (HITL) workflows integrate human judgment and oversight into automated processes. These workflows pause at critical points for human review, validation, or decision-making before proceeding. This approach combines the efficiency of automation with human expertise and oversight where it matters most.
documents.summary: This document explains the concept of Human-in-the-Loop (HITL) workflows and outlines best practices for integrating human oversight, maintaining state persistence, and implementing evaluation loops in automated systems.

documents.title: Calling LLMs
documents.description: title: Calling LLMs · Cloudflare Agents docs description: Different LLM providers offer models optimized for specific types of tasks. When building AI systems, choosing the right model is crucial for both performance and cost efficiency. lastUpdated: 2025-08-15T20:11:52.000Z chatbotDeprioritize:...
documents.summary: This document explains the differences between reasoning and instruction-based large language models and provides guidance on selecting the appropriate model type for specific tasks.

documents.title: Using AI Models
documents.description: title: Using AI Models · Cloudflare Agents docs description: "Agents can communicate with AI models hosted on any provider, including:" lastUpdated: 2025-08-19T11:42:14.000Z chatbotDeprioritize: false tags: AI source_url: html: https://developers.cloudflare.com/agents/api-reference/using-ai-mode...
documents.summary: This document explains how Cloudflare Agents integrate with external and internal AI models to handle long-running reasoning tasks, manage persistent conversation state, and stream responses.

documents.title: Agent class internals · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: The core of the agents library is the exported Agent class. Following the pattern from Durable Objects, the main API for developers is to extend the Agent class to inherit all the built-in features. While this effectively is a supercharged primitive that allows developers to only write the logic they need in their agents, it obscures the inner workings.
documents.summary: This document explains the underlying architecture of the Agent class, detailing its relationship with Durable Objects and PartyKit's Server to provide developers with a conceptual understanding of its inner workings.

documents.title: Concepts · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.summary: This document provides an index of core conceptual guides for Cloudflare Agents, covering foundational topics such as workflows, tools, and internal architecture.

documents.title: Tools · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: Tools enable AI systems to interact with external services and perform actions. They provide a structured way for agents and workflows to invoke APIs, manipulate data, and integrate with external systems. Tools form the bridge between AI decision-making capabilities and real-world actions.
documents.summary: This document explains the conceptual role of tools in AI systems, detailing how they bridge the gap between AI decision-making and real-world actions through function calls and protocols like MCP.

documents.title: Agents
documents.description: title: Agents · Cloudflare Agents docs description: An agent is an AI system that can autonomously execute tasks by making decisions about tool usage and process flow. Unlike traditional automation that follows predefined paths, agents can dynamically adapt their approach based on context and in...
documents.summary: This document defines AI agents and explains how they autonomously execute tasks by dynamically adapting to context and using integrated tools. It distinguishes agents from traditional linear workflows and human-guided co-pilots while outlining their core components and operational cycle.

documents.title: Workflows · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: A workflow is the orchestration layer that coordinates how an agent's components work together. It defines the structured paths through which tasks are processed, tools are called, and results are managed. While agents make dynamic decisions about what to do, workflows provide the underlying framework that governs how those decisions are executed.
documents.summary: This document defines workflows as the orchestration layer for agent systems and describes how they coordinate components like input processing, tool integration, and state management.

documents.title: Testing your Agents · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.description: Because Agents run on Cloudflare Workers and Durable Objects, they can be tested using the same tools and techniques as Workers and Durable Objects.
documents.summary: This document explains how to set up, write, and execute tests for Agents using Vitest and how to run them locally with Wrangler. It provides configuration steps for testing environments and instructions for unit testing Agent methods and state.

documents.title: Getting started · Cloudflare Agents docs
documents.summary: A curated list of resources and tutorials for building, testing, and prompting AI chat agents on the Cloudflare platform.

documents.description: Use the Workers "mega prompt" to build a Agents using your preferred AI tools and/or IDEs. The prompt understands the Agents SDK APIs, best practices and guidelines, and makes it easier to build valid Agents and Workers.

documents.title: Overview
documents.description: title: Cloudflare AI Search · Cloudflare AI Search docs description: Build scalable, fully-managed RAG applications with Cloudflare AI Search. Create retrieval-augmented generation pipelines to deliver accurate, context-aware AI without managing infrastructure. lastUpdated: 2025-09-24T17:03:07.0...
documents.summary: Cloudflare AI Search is a managed service designed to simplify the creation of RAG applications by providing automated indexing and natural language query capabilities. It integrates seamlessly with the Cloudflare developer ecosystem to deliver scalable, context-aware AI search without manual infrastructure management.

documents.title: MCP server · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.summary: The provided document is empty and does not contain any content or instructions to explain.

documents.title: Concepts · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.summary: This document provides a collection of conceptual resources explaining Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and the mechanics of AI-powered search.

documents.title: How AI Search works · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: AI Search (formerly AutoRAG) is Cloudflare’s managed search service. You can connect your data such as websites or unstructured content, and it automatically creates a continuously updating index that you can query with natural language in your applications or AI agents.
documents.summary: This document provides a high-level overview of Cloudflare AI Search, explaining the architectural workflows for both data indexing and natural language querying.

documents.title: Similarity cache · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: Similarity-based caching in AI Search lets you serve responses from Cloudflare’s cache for queries that are similar to previous requests, rather than creating new, unique responses for every request. This speeds up response times and cuts costs by reusing answers for questions that are close in meaning.
documents.summary: This document explains how similarity-based caching in AI Search optimizes response times by reusing answers for semantically similar prompts using MinHash and LSH technologies.

documents.title: Configuration · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: You can customize how your AI Search instance indexes your data, and retrieves and generates responses for queries. Some settings can be updated after the instance is created, while others are fixed at creation time.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive list of configuration settings for AI Search instances, detailing which parameters are editable after creation and their specific roles in indexing, retrieval, and generation.

documents.title: Chunking · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: Chunking is the process of splitting large data into smaller segments before embedding them for search. AI Search uses recursive chunking, which breaks your content at natural boundaries (like paragraphs or sentences), and then further splits it if the chunks are too large.
documents.summary: This document explains the process of recursive chunking in AI Search, detailing how content is split for embedding and how to configure chunk size and overlap parameters.

documents.title: Indexing · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: AI Search automatically indexes your data into vector embeddings optimized for semantic search. Once a data source is connected, indexing runs continuously in the background to keep your knowledge base fresh and queryable.
documents.summary: This document explains the automated and manual indexing processes for AI Search, detailing how data is converted into vector embeddings and managed via jobs and controls.

documents.title: What is RAG
documents.description: title: What is RAG · Cloudflare AI Search docs description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is a way to use your own data with a large language model (LLM). Instead of relying only on what the model was trained on, RAG searches for relevant information from your data source and uses it to h...
documents.summary: This document defines Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and explains how it integrates external data sources with large language models to provide accurate, grounded responses. It outlines the three-step pipeline of indexing, retrieval, and generation while highlighting the benefits of reducing model hallucinations without requiring fine-tuning.

documents.title: Reranking · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: Reranking can help improve the quality of AI Search results by reordering retrieved documents based on semantic relevance to the user’s query. It applies a secondary model after retrieval to "rerank" the top results before they are outputted.
documents.summary: This document explains how to enable and configure reranking in AI Search to improve retrieval accuracy by reordering results based on semantic relevance using a secondary model.

documents.title: Retrieval configuration · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: AI Search allows you to configure how content is retrieved from your vector index and used to generate a final response. Two options control this behavior:
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure retrieval settings in AI Search, specifically the similarity threshold and the maximum number of results used for semantic search.

documents.title: Path filtering · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: Path filtering allows you to control which files or URLs are indexed by defining include and exclude patterns. Use this to limit indexing to specific content or to skip files you do not want searchable.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure path filtering for AI Search data sources using inclusion and exclusion rules to control which content is indexed.

documents.title: Service API token · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: A service API token grants AI Search permission to access and configure resources in your Cloudflare account. This token is different from API tokens you use to interact with your AI Search instance.
documents.summary: This document explains the purpose and lifecycle of service API tokens in Cloudflare AI Search, detailing how they differ from standard API tokens and how to manage them via the dashboard or API.

documents.title: Query rewriting · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: Query rewriting is an optional step in the AI Search pipeline that improves retrieval quality by transforming the original user query into a more effective search query.
documents.summary: Explains how query rewriting uses Large Language Models to transform user queries into optimized search terms for improved vector retrieval accuracy.

documents.title: System prompt · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: System prompts allow you to guide the behavior of the text-generation models used by AI Search at query time. AI Search supports system prompt configuration in two steps:
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and use system prompts in AI Search to control model behavior during query rewriting and response generation. It details setup methods via the Cloudflare dashboard and API to customize AI behavior and improve retrieval accuracy.

documents.title: Metadata · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: Use metadata to filter documents before retrieval and provide context to guide AI responses. This page covers how to apply filters and attach optional context metadata to your files.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use metadata for filtering search results and providing additional context for AI responses in retrieval-augmented generation. It covers comparison operators, compound filter schemas, and the implementation of context fields for LLM guidance.

documents.title: Bring your own generation model
documents.description: title: Bring your own generation model · Cloudflare AI Search docs description: When using AI Search, AI Search leverages a Workers AI model to generate the response. If you want to use a model outside of Workers AI, you can use AI Search for search while leveraging a model outside of Workers AI...
documents.summary: This guide explains how to use Cloudflare AI Search for document retrieval while leveraging external language models, such as OpenAI, for response generation.

documents.title: Build a RAG from your website · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: AI Search is designed to work out of the box with data in R2 buckets. But what if your content lives on a website or needs to be rendered dynamically?
documents.summary: This tutorial explains how to ingest dynamic website content into AI Search by using Cloudflare Browser Rendering to scrape pages and R2 buckets for storage. It provides step-by-step instructions for building a Worker with Puppeteer and configuring an AI Search instance for retrieval-augmented generation.

documents.title: Create multitenancy · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: AI Search supports multitenancy by letting you segment content by tenant, so each user, customer, or workspace can only access their own data. This is typically done by organizing documents into per-tenant folders and applying metadata filters at query time.
documents.summary: This document explains how to implement multitenancy in AI Search by organizing content into tenant-specific folders and applying metadata filters to isolate data access.

documents.title: Create a simple search engine · Cloudflare AI Search docs
documents.description: By using the search method, you can implement a simple but fast search engine. This example uses Workers Binding, but can be easily adapted to use the REST API instead.
documents.summary: This document explains how to implement a search engine using the AI Search search method with Workers Binding. It provides specific configuration tips and code examples in JavaScript and TypeScript for handling user queries.

documents.title: Cloudflare AI Gateway
documents.description: title: Overview · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs description: Cloudflare's AI Gateway allows you to gain visibility and control over your AI apps. By connecting your apps to AI Gateway, you can gather insights on how people are using your application with analytics and logging and then control how y...
documents.summary: Cloudflare AI Gateway provides observability and control for AI applications through features like analytics, logging, caching, and rate limiting. It allows developers to monitor usage and optimize performance across multiple AI model providers.

documents.title: Authenticated Gateway · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: Add security by requiring a valid authorization token for each request.
documents.summary: This document explains how to secure Cloudflare AI Gateway by enabling Authenticated Gateway, requiring a specific authorization header to prevent unauthorized access and protect log storage.

documents.title: Custom costs · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: Override default or public model costs on a per-request basis.
documents.summary: This document explains how to override default model pricing in AI Gateway by using custom headers to specify per-token costs for input and output requests.

documents.title: BYOK (Store Keys) · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: Bring your own keys (BYOK) is a feature in Cloudflare AI Gateway that allows you to securely store your AI provider API keys directly in the Cloudflare dashboard. Instead of including API keys in every request to your AI models, you can configure them once in the dashboard, and reference them in your gateway configuration.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use the Bring Your Own Keys (BYOK) feature in Cloudflare AI Gateway to securely store and manage AI provider API keys. It provides instructions for configuring keys in the dashboard and updating application requests to use stored secrets.

documents.title: Custom Providers · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: Create and manage custom AI providers for your account.
documents.summary: This document explains how to integrate and manage non-native AI providers within AI Gateway using the Cloudflare API and dashboard. It details how to configure custom endpoints to leverage features like observability, caching, and rate limiting.

documents.title: Configuration · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: Configure your AI Gateway with multiple options and customizations.
documents.summary: This document provides a directory of configuration options for Cloudflare AI Gateway, covering features like key storage, custom providers, request handling, and authentication.

documents.title: Fallbacks · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: Specify model or provider fallbacks with your Universal endpoint to handle request failures and ensure reliability.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure model and provider fallbacks using the AI Gateway Universal endpoint to ensure request reliability and high availability. It describes the fallback logic triggered by failures or timeouts and explains how to track successful requests using the step response header.

documents.title: Add Human Feedback using API · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: This guide will walk you through the steps of adding human feedback to an AI Gateway request using the Cloudflare API. You will learn how to retrieve the relevant request logs, and submit feedback using the API.
documents.summary: This guide explains how to programmatically add human feedback to Cloudflare AI Gateway requests by retrieving log IDs and submitting feedback via the Cloudflare API.

documents.title: Add human feedback using Worker Bindings · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: This guide explains how to provide human feedback for AI Gateway evaluations using Worker bindings.
documents.summary: This document explains how to implement human feedback loops for AI Gateway evaluations using Worker bindings and the patchLog method.

documents.title: Manage gateways · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: You have several different options for managing an AI Gateway.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for managing AI Gateways through the Cloudflare dashboard and API, covering creation, modification, and deletion processes.

documents.title: Add Human Feedback using Dashboard · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: Human feedback is a valuable metric to assess the performance of your AI models. By incorporating human feedback, you can gain deeper insights into how the model's responses are perceived and how well it performs from a user-centric perspective. This feedback can then be used in evaluations to calculate performance metrics, driving optimization and ultimately enhancing the reliability, accuracy, and efficiency of your AI application.
documents.summary: This tutorial explains how to provide and analyze human feedback for AI models using the Cloudflare AI Gateway dashboard to improve performance metrics. It guides users through logging interactions, rating model responses with thumbs-up or thumbs-down icons, and incorporating these ratings into evaluations.

documents.title: Request handling · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: Your AI gateway supports different strategies for handling requests to providers, which allows you to manage AI interactions effectively and ensure your applications remain responsive and reliable.
documents.summary: Explains how to configure request timeouts and automatic retries for AI provider interactions through Cloudflare AI Gateway's Universal Endpoint and direct provider requests.

documents.title: Features · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: AI Gateway provides a comprehensive set of features to help you build, deploy, and manage AI applications with confidence. From performance optimization to security and observability, these features work together to create a robust AI infrastructure.
documents.summary: This document provides an overview of Cloudflare AI Gateway's core features, including tools for performance optimization, security guardrails, observability, and advanced request management.

documents.title: Evaluations · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: Understanding your application's performance is essential for optimization. Developers often have different priorities, and finding the optimal solution involves balancing key factors such as cost, latency, and accuracy. Some prioritize low-latency responses, while others focus on accuracy or cost-efficiency.
documents.summary: This document introduces AI Gateway Evaluations, a tool for analyzing and optimizing AI application metrics such as performance, cost, and accuracy using log-based datasets.

documents.description: Use the Cloudflare billing to pay for and authenticate your inference requests.
documents.summary: This document explains how to set up and manage Unified Billing for Cloudflare AI Gateway, allowing users to pay for multiple AI providers through a single Cloudflare invoice. It covers loading credits, setting spend limits, and configuring Zero Data Retention for supported models.

documents.summary: This guide explains how to configure and run evaluations in Cloudflare AI Gateway to analyze AI application performance using log-based datasets. It covers the process of filtering logs, selecting evaluation metrics like cost and speed, and interpreting results for model optimization.

documents.title: Caching · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs

documents.title: Data Loss Prevention (DLP) · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: Data Loss Prevention (DLP) for AI Gateway helps protect your organization from inadvertent exposure of sensitive data through AI interactions. By integrating with Cloudflare's proven DLP technology, AI Gateway can scan both incoming prompts and outgoing AI responses for sensitive information, ensuring your AI applications maintain security and compliance standards.
documents.summary: This document introduces Data Loss Prevention (DLP) for AI Gateway, explaining how it secures AI interactions by scanning prompts and responses for sensitive information. It outlines key benefits such as compliance and zero-code integration with existing Cloudflare security policies.

documents.title: Dynamic routing · Cloudflare AI Gateway docs
documents.description: Dynamic routing enables you to create request routing flows through a visual interface or a JSON-based configuration. Instead of hard-coding a single model, with Dynamic Routing you compose a small flow that evaluates conditions, enforces quotas, and chooses models with fallbacks. You can iterate without touching application code—publish a new route version and you’re done. With dynamic routing, you can easily implement advanced use cases such as:
documents.summary: This document explains how to implement and configure dynamic routing for AI requests to manage model selection, rate limits, and A/B testing using a visual editor or JSON configuration.

documents.summary: This document outlines the usage limits, concurrency rules, and troubleshooting steps for Cloudflare Workers Browser Rendering on both Free and Paid plans.

documents.title: Stagehand · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: Deploy a Stagehand server that uses Browser Rendering to provide browser automation capabilities to your agents.
documents.summary: This guide explains how to integrate the Stagehand AI browser automation library with Cloudflare Workers using Browser Rendering and Workers AI.

documents.title: Use browser rendering with AI
documents.description: title: Use browser rendering with AI · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs description: >- The ability to browse websites can be crucial when building workflows with AI. Here, we provide an example where we use Browser Rendering to visit
documents.summary: This document explains how to integrate Cloudflare Browser Rendering with Workers AI to scrape website content and use a large language model to convert extracted text into structured JSON data.

documents.title: Generate PDFs Using HTML and CSS · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: As seen in this Workers bindings guide, Browser Rendering can be used to generate screenshots for any given URL. Alongside screenshots, you can also generate full PDF documents for a given webpage, and can also provide the webpage markup and style ourselves.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use Cloudflare Browser Rendering to generate PDF documents from custom HTML and CSS via the REST API or Workers Bindings using Puppeteer.

documents.title: Tutorials · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.summary: This document provides a list of links to tutorials and implementation guides for using the Cloudflare Browser Rendering service for tasks like PDF generation, web crawling, and AI integration.

documents.title: Build a web crawler with Queues and Browser Rendering · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.summary: The provided document is empty and contains no textual content to summarize or categorize.

documents.title: Playwright · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: Learn how to use Playwright with Cloudflare Workers for browser automation. Access Playwright API, manage sessions, and optimize browser rendering.
documents.summary: This document explains how to set up and use the Cloudflare fork of Playwright for browser automation within Cloudflare Workers, covering installation, configuration requirements, and implementation patterns.

documents.title: Playwright MCP
documents.description: title: Playwright MCP · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs description: Deploy a Playwright MCP server that uses Browser Rendering to provide browser automation capabilities to your agents. lastUpdated: 2026-01-12T09:46:29.000Z chatbotDeprioritize: false tags: MCP source_url: html: https://develo...
documents.summary: This document explains how to deploy and use the Cloudflare Playwright MCP server to enable browser automation for LLM agents using Cloudflare Browser Rendering and Workers.

documents.title: Automatic request headers · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: Cloudflare automatically attaches headers to every REST API request made through Browser Rendering. These headers make it easy for destination servers to identify that these requests came from Cloudflare.
documents.summary: This document lists and explains the immutable HTTP headers attached to Cloudflare Browser Rendering requests to assist with origin identification and security verification.

documents.title: Supported fonts · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: Browser Rendering uses a managed Chromium environment that includes a standard set of fonts. When you generate a screenshot or PDF, text is rendered using the fonts available in this environment.
documents.summary: This document lists the pre-installed system and international fonts available in the Browser Rendering environment and explains how to inject custom fonts via Puppeteer, Playwright, and REST API.

documents.title: REST API timeouts · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description:
Browser Rendering uses several independent timers to manage how long different parts of a request can take.
If any of these timers exceed their limit, the request returns a timeout error.
documents.summary: This document explains the various timeout parameters and navigation settings used to control the lifecycle of a browser rendering request. It provides a reference for configuring timers such as page load, selector waiting, and action execution to handle dynamic content effectively.

documents.title: Browser close reasons · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: A browser session may close for a variety of reasons, occasionally due to connection errors or errors in the headless browser instance. As a best practice, wrap puppeteer.connect or puppeteer.launch in a try/catch statement.
documents.summary: This document explains how to handle and troubleshoot browser session closures in Cloudflare Browser Rendering, including how to access logs and common reasons for termination.

documents.title: Reference · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.summary: This document provides a collection of reference guides for Cloudflare Browser Rendering, covering technical details such as headers, fonts, timeouts, and CLI integration.

documents.title: REST API · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description:
The REST API is a RESTful interface that provides endpoints for common browser actions such as capturing screenshots, extracting HTML content, generating PDFs, and more.
The following are the available options:
documents.summary: This document provides an overview of the Browser Rendering REST API, highlighting available endpoints for browser automation tasks like screenshots, PDF generation, and data extraction.

documents.title: /json - Capture structured data using AI
documents.description: title: /json - Capture structured data using AI · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs description: The /json endpoint extracts structured data from a webpage. You can specify the expected output using either a prompt or a response_format parameter which accepts a JSON schema. The endpoint returns ...
documents.summary: This document describes the Cloudflare Browser Rendering /json endpoint, which uses AI to extract structured data from webpages based on prompts or JSON schemas. It explains how to configure extraction parameters and provides examples for integrating the API into automated workflows.

documents.title: /content - Fetch HTML · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: The /content endpoint instructs the browser to navigate to a website and capture the fully rendered HTML of a page, including the head section, after JavaScript execution. This is ideal for capturing content from JavaScript-heavy or interactive websites.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use the Cloudflare Browser Rendering API's /content endpoint to capture fully rendered HTML from dynamic and JavaScript-heavy websites.

documents.title: Wrangler · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: Use Wrangler, a command-line tool, to deploy projects using Cloudflare's Workers Browser Rendering API.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and deploy Cloudflare Workers that use the Browser Rendering API using the Wrangler command-line tool.

documents.title: Reference · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.summary: The provided document is empty and does not contain any content or instructions to summarize.

documents.title: /links - Retrieve links from a webpage · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: The /links endpoint retrieves all links from a webpage. It can be used to extract all links from a page, including those that are hidden.
documents.summary: This document provides technical details for the /links endpoint within Cloudflare's browser-rendering API, which is used to extract all visible and hidden links from a specific URL or HTML string.

documents.title: /markdown - Extract Markdown from a webpage · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: The /markdown endpoint retrieves a webpage's content and converts it into Markdown format. You can specify a URL and optional parameters to refine the extraction process.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use the Cloudflare Browser Rendering markdown endpoint to convert webpage URLs or raw HTML into Markdown format.

documents.title: /scrape - Scrape HTML elements · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: The /scrape endpoint extracts structured data from specific elements on a webpage, returning details such as element dimensions and inner HTML.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use the /scrape endpoint to programmatically extract structured content, dimensions, and metadata from web pages using CSS selectors.

documents.title: /screenshot - Capture screenshot · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: The /screenshot endpoint renders the webpage by processing its HTML and JavaScript, then captures a screenshot of the fully rendered page.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use the Cloudflare Browser Rendering screenshot endpoint to capture images of webpages or custom HTML content via API requests.

documents.description: title: Workers Bindings · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs description: "Workers Bindings allow you to execute advanced browser rendering scripts within Cloudflare Workers. They provide developers the flexibility to automate and control complex workflows and browser interactions. The following ...

documents.title: Deploy a Browser Rendering Worker with Durable Objects
documents.description: title: Deploy a Browser Rendering Worker with Durable Objects · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs description: Use the Browser Rendering API along with Durable Objects to take screenshots from web pages and store them in R2. lastUpdated: 2026-01-12T09:46:29.000Z chatbotDeprioritize: false tags: ...

documents.title: Reuse sessions · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: The best way to improve the performance of your browser rendering Worker is to reuse sessions. One way to do that is via Durable Objects, which allows you to keep a long running connection from a Worker to a browser. Another way is to keep the browser open after you've finished with it, and connect to that session each time you have a new request.

documents.title: /pdf - Render PDF · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: The /pdf endpoint instructs the browser to generate a PDF of a webpage or custom HTML using Cloudflare's headless browser rendering service.

documents.title: /snapshot - Take a webpage snapshot · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: The /snapshot endpoint captures both the HTML content and a screenshot of the webpage in one request. It returns the HTML as a text string and the screenshot as a Base64-encoded image.

documents.description: Cloudflare for Platforms is used by leading platforms big and small to:

documents.title: Deploy a Browser Rendering Worker · Cloudflare Browser Rendering docs
documents.description: By following this guide, you will create a Worker that uses the Browser Rendering API to take screenshots from web pages. This is a common use case for browser automation.
